Bibliographic Ghosts: Worcester, Worcester Cathedral Library F.19: not in this MS; Oxford, Lincoln College Lat. 52: not in this MS.
_description:
A tag in the Fasciculus morum (Foster (1940)
XFoster, Frances Allen. “Some English Words from the Fasciculus Morum.” Essays and Studies in Honor of Carleton Brown. Percy Waldron Long New York: NYU Press; London: Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Pres, 1940: 149-57, sermons no.5) — one couplet translating a sermon theme, 1 Macc. 1.42

Bod187.Transcription:
As moche as was hys worschyp ȝut more was hys
                    shameshep

Bod332.Transcription:
Als muche as was his wirshipȝit more was hys
                    shenshippe

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
As myche as was wyrchepeȝyt more was ys schenchepe
                    [sic]

BodLauMis568.Transcription:
As moche as was his worschup ȝut more was his
                    schameschep

OxfCCC218.Transcription:
As moche as was hys worschepȝut more was hys
                    schamschep
OxfCCC218.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 202.

CamGon71.Transcription:
As myche os was hys wrschepeȜit more was hys
                    schenchepe

DULCosViv2.Transcription: Als muche was his worshipȝet more was his shenshippe

EDU82.Transcription:
As mekel as was his wurscippeȜut more was his
                    schamchip

Spalding.Transcription:
Also mekyll was his wirshippeand yet more was his
                    shameshyppe
